headline: Dominion Energy Expands US$65b Plan As Data Centers Shape Growth
summary: Dominion Energy (NYSE:D) lifted its five year capital investment plan to $65b, a 30% increase, focused largely on soaring data center power demand in Virginia. The company highlighted record financial performance alongside progress on its Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind project. Management framed the larger spend as a response to long term load growth and evolving sources of future earnings. For investors watching regulated utilities, Dominion Energy is putting real numbers behind the data...

headline: Dominion Energy details its $65B, five-year spending plan
summary: Data center demand is driving load forecasts and robust capital spending plans as Coastal Virginia Offshore Wind nears the finish line, company executives said Monday.

headline: Dow Tumbles Over 800 Points On Tariff Concerns: Investor Sentiment Declines, Greed Index Remains In 'Fear' Zone
summary: Fear & Greed index rises, Dow Jones dips over 800pts due to AI-credit concerns & trade uncertainty. Trump increases global tariff to 15%.
